trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app (HTML 5) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app (HTML 5) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to get started using Mobile Services in an existing HTML app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to get started using Mobile Services in an existing HTML app.

trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to leverage data in an HTML app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to leverage data in an HTML app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the mobile service with the app, and then sign in to the Azure Management Portal to view changes to data made when running the app.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the mobile service with the app, and then sign in to the Azure Management Portal to view changes to data made when running the app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to use Azure to store and retrieve data from an HTML app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to use Azure to store and retrieve data from an HTML app.

trans-unit.source: As such, this topic walks you through many of the steps that are completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: As such, this topic walks you through many of the steps that are completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A756A2826&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2documentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-html-get-started-data).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A756A2826&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2documentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-html-get-started-data).

trans-unit.source: Additional requirements
trans-unit.target: Additional requirements

trans-unit.source: You can host the GetStartedWithData app on any web server.
trans-unit.target: You can host the GetStartedWithData app on any web server.

trans-unit.source: However, for your convenience scripts have been provided that enable you to run the app on `http://localhost:8000`.
trans-unit.target: However, for your convenience scripts have been provided that enable you to run the app on `http://localhost:8000`.

trans-unit.source: To use localhost, this tutorial requires that you have one of the following web servers running on your local computer:
trans-unit.target: To use localhost, this tutorial requires that you have one of the following web servers running on your local computer:

trans-unit.source: **On Windows**: IIS Express.
trans-unit.target: **On Windows**: IIS Express.

trans-unit.source: IIS Express is installed by the [Microsoft Web Platform Installer].
trans-unit.target: IIS Express is installed by the [Microsoft Web Platform Installer].

trans-unit.source: **On MacOS X**: Python, which should already be installed.
trans-unit.target: **On MacOS X**: Python, which should already be installed.

trans-unit.source: **On Linux**: Python.
trans-unit.target: **On Linux**: Python.

trans-unit.source: You must install the [latest version of Python].
trans-unit.target: You must install the [latest version of Python].

trans-unit.source: You can use any web server to host the app, but these are the web servers that are supported by the downloaded scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any web server to host the app, but these are the web servers that are supported by the downloaded scripts.

trans-unit.source: A web browser that supports HTML5.
trans-unit.target: A web browser that supports HTML5.

trans-unit.source: Download the GetStartedWithData project
trans-unit.target: Download the GetStartedWithData project

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is built on the [GetStartedWithData app], which is an HTML5 app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is built on the [GetStartedWithData app], which is an HTML5 app.

trans-unit.source: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.
trans-unit.target: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.

trans-unit.source: [Download the HTML app project files][GetStartedWithData app].
trans-unit.target: [Download the HTML app project files][GetStartedWithData app].

trans-unit.source: In an HTML editor, open the downloaded project and examine the app.js file.
trans-unit.target: In an HTML editor, open the downloaded project and examine the app.js file.

trans-unit.source: Notice that added items are stored in an in-memory **Array** object (**staticItems**).
trans-unit.target: Notice that added items are stored in an in-memory **Array** object (**staticItems**).

trans-unit.source: Refresh the page, and the data disappears.
trans-unit.target: Refresh the page, and the data disappears.

trans-unit.source: It is not persisted.
trans-unit.target: It is not persisted.

trans-unit.source: Launch one of the following command files from the **server** subfolder.
trans-unit.target: Launch one of the following command files from the **server** subfolder.

trans-unit.source: **launch-windows** (Windows computers)
trans-unit.target: **launch-windows** (Windows computers)

trans-unit.source: **launch-mac.command** (Mac OS X computers)
trans-unit.target: **launch-mac.command** (Mac OS X computers)

trans-unit.source: **launch-linux.sh** (Linux computers)
trans-unit.target: **launch-linux.sh** (Linux computers)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] On a Windows computer, type `R` when PowerShell asks you to confirm that you want to run the script.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] On a Windows computer, type `R` when PowerShell asks you to confirm that you want to run the script.

trans-unit.source: Your web browser might warn you to not run the script because it was downloaded from the internet.
trans-unit.target: Your web browser might warn you to not run the script because it was downloaded from the internet.

trans-unit.source: When this happens, you must request that the browser proceed to load the script
trans-unit.target: When this happens, you must request that the browser proceed to load the script

trans-unit.source: This starts a web server on your local computer to host the new app.
trans-unit.target: This starts a web server on your local computer to host the new app.

trans-unit.source: Open the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser to start the app.
trans-unit.target: Open the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser to start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_, in **Enter new task**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_, in **Enter new task**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the saved text is added to the **staticItems** array, and the page is refreshed to display the new item.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the saved text is added to the **staticItems** array, and the page is refreshed to display the new item.

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Add a new table to the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Add a new table to the mobile service

trans-unit.source: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table in the associated SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table in the associated SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Data** tab, then click **+Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Data** tab, then click **+Create**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Create new table** dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Create new table** dialog.

trans-unit.source: In **Table name** type _TodoItem_, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In **Table name** type _TodoItem_, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new storage table **TodoItem** with the default permissions set.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new storage table **TodoItem** with the default permissions set.

trans-unit.source: This means that anyone with the application key, which is distributed with your app, can access and change data in the table.
trans-unit.target: This means that anyone with the application key, which is distributed with your app, can access and change data in the table.

trans-unit.source: The table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.
trans-unit.target: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.

trans-unit.source: Click the new **TodoItem** table and verify that there are no data rows.
trans-unit.target: Click the new **TodoItem** table and verify that there are no data rows.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]New tables are created with the Id, __createdAt, __updatedAt, and __version columns.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]New tables are created with the Id, __createdAt, __updatedAt, and __version columns.

trans-unit.source: When dynamic schema is enabled, Mobile Services automatically generates new columns based on the JSON object in the insert or update request.
trans-unit.target: When dynamic schema is enabled, Mobile Services automatically generates new columns based on the JSON object in the insert or update request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Dynamic schema](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj193175.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Dynamic schema](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj193175.aspx).

trans-unit.source: In the **Configure** tab, verify that `localhost` is already listed in the **Allow requests from host names** list under **Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configure** tab, verify that `localhost` is already listed in the **Allow requests from host names** list under **Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)**.

trans-unit.source: If it's not, type `localhost` in the **Host name** field and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: If it's not, type `localhost` in the **Host name** field and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.

trans-unit.source: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access
trans-unit.target: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access

trans-unit.source: Now that your mobile service is ready, you can update the app to store items in Mobile Services instead of the local collection.
trans-unit.target: Now that your mobile service is ready, you can update the app to store items in Mobile Services instead of the local collection.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Dashboard** tab and make a note of the **Mobile Service URL**, then click **Manage keys** and make a note of the **Application key**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Dashboard** tab and make a note of the **Mobile Service URL**, then click **Manage keys** and make a note of the **Application key**.

trans-unit.source: You will need these values when accessing the mobile service from your app code.
trans-unit.target: You will need these values when accessing the mobile service from your app code.

trans-unit.source: In your web editor, open the index.html project file and add the following to the script references for the page:
trans-unit.target: In your web editor, open the index.html project file and add the following to the script references for the page:

trans-unit.source: In the editor, open the file app.js, uncomment the following code that defines the **MobileServiceClient** variable, and supply the URL and application key from the mobile service in the **MobileServiceClient** constructor, in that order:
trans-unit.target: In the editor, open the file app.js, uncomment the following code that defines the **MobileServiceClient** variable, and supply the URL and application key from the mobile service in the **MobileServiceClient** constructor, in that order:

trans-unit.source: This creates a new instance of MobileServiceClient that is used to access your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new instance of MobileServiceClient that is used to access your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Comment-out the following lines of code:
trans-unit.target: Comment-out the following lines of code:

trans-unit.source: Data will be stored in the mobile service and not in an in-memory array.
trans-unit.target: Data will be stored in the mobile service and not in an in-memory array.

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: This code creates a proxy object (**todoItemTable**) for the SQL Database **TodoItem**.
trans-unit.target: This code creates a proxy object (**todoItemTable**) for the SQL Database **TodoItem**.

trans-unit.source: Replace the **$('#add-item').submit** event handler with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **$('#add-item').submit** event handler with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This code inserts a new item into the table.
trans-unit.target: This code inserts a new item into the table.

trans-unit.source: Replace the **refreshTodoItems** method with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **refreshTodoItems** method with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This sends a query to the mobile service that returns all items.
trans-unit.target: This sends a query to the mobile service that returns all items.

trans-unit.source: The results is iterated over and data is displayed on the page.
trans-unit.target: The results is iterated over and data is displayed on the page.

trans-unit.source: Replace the **$(document.body).on('change', '.item-text')** and **$(document.body).on('change', '.item-complete')** event handlers with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **$(document.body).on('change', '.item-text')** and **$(document.body).on('change', '.item-complete')** event handlers with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This sends an item update to the mobile service when text is changed or when the box is checked.
trans-unit.target: This sends an item update to the mobile service when text is changed or when the box is checked.

trans-unit.source: Replace the **$(document.body).on('click', '.item-delete')** event handler with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **$(document.body).on('click', '.item-delete')** event handler with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This sends a delete to the mobile service when the **Delete** button is clicked.
trans-unit.target: This sends a delete to the mobile service when the **Delete** button is clicked.

trans-unit.source: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for backend storage, it's time to test the app against Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for backend storage, it's time to test the app against Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Test the app against your new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against your new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Reload the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser start the app.
trans-unit.target: Reload the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser start the app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you need to restart the web server, repeat the steps in the first section.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you need to restart the web server, repeat the steps in the first section.

trans-unit.source: As before, type text in **Enter new task**, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: As before, type text in **Enter new task**, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Data** tab, then click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Data** tab, then click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the **TodoItem** table now contains data, with id values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the **TodoItem** table now contains data, with id values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, check one of the items in the list, then go back to the Browse tab in the portal and click **Refresh**.
trans-unit.target: In the app, check one of the items in the list, then go back to the Browse tab in the portal and click **Refresh**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the complete value has changed from **false** to **true**.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the complete value has changed from **false** to **true**.

trans-unit.source: In the app.js project file, locate the **RefreshTodoItems** method and replace the line of code that defines `query` with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the app.js project file, locate the **RefreshTodoItems** method and replace the line of code that defines `query` with the following:

trans-unit.source: Load the page again, check another one of the items in the list.
trans-unit.target: Load the page again, check another one of the items in the list.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the checked item now disappears from the list.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the checked item now disappears from the list.

trans-unit.source: Each update results in a round-trip to the mobile service, which now returns filtered data.
trans-unit.target: Each update results in a round-trip to the mobile service, which now returns filtered data.

trans-unit.source: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an HTML app to work with data in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an HTML app to work with data in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Next, learn how to authenticate users of your app try one of these other tutorials by completing [Add authentication to your app].
trans-unit.target: Next, learn how to authenticate users of your app try one of these other tutorials by completing [Add authentication to your app].

trans-unit.source: If you are working with a Cordova or PhoneGap app project, learn more about push notifications in [Push Notifications to Cordova Apps with Microsoft Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/magazine/dn879353.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you are working with a Cordova or PhoneGap app project, learn more about push notifications in [Push Notifications to Cordova Apps with Microsoft Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/magazine/dn879353.aspx).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
